project.teaser: The transition from H2020 to HE reflects an ongoing mega-trend in ICT: the convergence of Cloud, Edge, and IoT. This tendency has significant impact in Europe at scientific, technological, socio-economic, and geopolitical levels, as these traditionally separated fields are now...
project.objective: The transition from H2020 to HE reflects an ongoing mega-trend in ICT: the convergence of Cloud, Edge, and IoT. This tendency has significant impact in Europe at scientific, technological, socio-economic, and geopolitical levels, as these traditionally separated fields are now converging into a much larger ecosystem now sharing a number of common challenges and key priorities. Upcoming RIAs should integrate and capitalise on ongoing efforts, with a vital aspect for Europe in this whole process being to successfully combine and consolidate the technology priorities defined by EU industry through the “European Alliance for Industrial Data, Edge and Cloud” and the advancements that the IPCEI-CIS will provide in the coming years. This transition and the move of the whole community of EC-funded projects and related initiatives towards a closer cooperation with industry is what the NexusForum.EU project aims to support and facilitate by focusing on consolidating research and policy along the Cognitive Computing Continuum, something crucial to effectively expand what the ongoing CSAs (particularly EUCloudEdgeIoT) are working on, thus providing a clear, consistent vision for future research and innovation topics in this EU strategic area. NexusForum.EU, through its unique consortium, will be able to effectively undertake a number of crucial activities, such as producing annual research roadmaps and policy recommendations; fostering collaboration between industry and academia; creating solid links with the IPCEI-CIS and the “European Alliance for Industrial Data, Edge and Cloud”; collaborating with past and present RIAs in order to promote a diverse EU research and innovation community; identifying relevant issues such skills development gaps; analysing the relationship with crucial topics such as Open Source and Open Standards; and engaging with forward-looking research and innovation communities and strategic initiatives outside Europe (starting with Japan & South Korea).
project.title: Consolidating Research and Policy along the Cognitive Computing Continuum
project.keywords: cloud edge IoT cognitive computing continuum

result.title: Engagement & Community Report - a
result.description: This document provides detailed information about the community structure implemented by the Project and the definition and execution of the engagement actions involving the European research and industry ecosystem, as well as other relevant initiatives and user communities across different sectors. It is an ongoing deliverable with an initial version in M6 and subsequent, updated versions to be produced in M18 and M30.

result.title: Communication & Dissemination Plan and Report - a
result.description: This document provides information about the Project’s communication and dissemination plan including the specification of the target dissemination groups, the publication policy, event planning, and marketing. It also reports the dissemination activities that will take place throughout the Project. It is an ongoing deliverable with an initial version in M6 and subsequent, updated versions to be produced in M18 and M30.

result.title: Data & Outputs Management Plan - b
result.description: The Project will produce a detailed Data Management Plan (DMP), including an Open Research Data Plan (ORDP), for making the data/outputs findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable (FAIR) as a deliverable in M6, and will be revised towards the end of the Project’s lifetime in M18 and M30.

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Engagement & Community Report - b
result.description: This document provides detailed information about the community structure implemented by the Project and the definition and execution of the engagement actions involving the European research and industry ecosystem, as well as other relevant initiatives and user communities across different sectors. It is an ongoing deliverable with an initial version in M6 and subsequent, updated versions to be produced in M18 and M30.

result.title: Data & Outputs Management Plan - a
result.description: The Project will produce a detailed Data Management Plan (DMP), including an Open Research Data Plan (ORDP), for making the data/outputs findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable (FAIR) as a deliverable in M6, and will be revised towards the end of the Project’s lifetime in M18 and M30.

result.title: Research & Innovation Roadmap - a
result.description: The Project will publish its annual Cognitive Computing Continuum Research & Innovation Roadmap for Europe as a deliverable in M6, and will be revised later on towards the end of the Project’s lifetime in M18 and M30. The first version (v1) will present the strategy and methodology for producing the roadmaps, the initial scope, selection of topics, and research directions as well as preliminary but substantial high level views on the strategic orientations for the next Framework Programme.

result.title: Research & Innovation Roadmap - b
result.description: In the second iteration of the Cognitive Computing Continuum Research & Innovation Roadmap (v2), we will update the research landscape while further developing potential synergies from a global perspective. The long-term vision will continue to evolve gradually.

result.title: Communication & Dissemination Plan and Report - b
result.description: This document provides information about the Project’s communication and dissemination plan including the specification of the target dissemination groups, the publication policy, event planning, and marketing. It also reports the dissemination activities that will take place throughout the Project. It is an ongoing deliverable with an initial version in M6 and subsequent, updated versions to be produced in M18 and M30.

result.title: Digital Policy Report - b
result.description: The Project will publish its annual EU Research & Policy Alignment Recommendations Report as a deliverable in M9, and will be revised later on towards the end of the Project’s lifetime in M18 and M30. The first iteration will present the methodology and the necessary steps that will be implemented, including the initial set of gaps and needs identified at policy and regulatory domain level. The second and third versions will provide incremental versions of the policy roadmap, which will also be accompanied by high impact policy briefs.

result.title: Digital Policy Report - a
result.description: The Project will publish its annual EU Research & Policy Alignment Recommendations Report as a deliverable in M9, and will be revised later on towards the end of the Project’s lifetime in M18 and M30. The first iteration will present the methodology and the necessary steps that will be implemented, including the initial set of gaps and needs identified at policy and regulatory domain level. The second and third versions will provide incremental versions of the policy roadmap, which will also be accompanied by high impact policy briefs.

category.title: internet of things
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
